org.rdkit.knime.headers

Interface HeaderPropertyHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHeaderPropertyHandler, FingerprintSettingsHeaderPropertyHandler, SmilesHeaderPropertyHandler

    public interface HeaderPropertyHandler
    A header property handler is capable of rendering properties contained in a column header. For this purpose the string value of one or more properties is evaluated and converted into a DataValue object. That object will get rendered in the RDKit Interactive View.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HeaderProperty createHeaderProperty(DataColumnSpec colSpec)
      Creates based on a property or properties found in the specified column specification a header property object, which is at the same time a data value object that will be passed to the renderer later for rendering it into a header or tooltip.
      java.lang.String[] getAcceptableProperties()
      Returns the property keys that this handler is capable of processing.
      java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> getDataValueClass()
      Returns the data value class that is used to visualize the property or properties.
      RepresentationMode getDefaultRepresentationMode()
      Returns the default representation mode to be used for this handler.
      java.lang.String getDisplayName()
      Returns the display name of this handler.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Returns the unique id of this handler.
      java.awt.Dimension getPreferredDimension(HeaderProperty headerProperty)
      Returns the preferred dimension that shall be used when visualizing the data value of the property.
      DataValueRenderer getPreferredRenderer(HeaderProperty headerProperty)
      Returns the render set in the preferences to be used for visualizing the data value of the property.
      DataValueRendererFactory[] getRendererFactories()
      Returns alle renderer factories that are able to render the data value representation of the property.
      boolean isCompatible(DataColumnSpec colSpec)
      Determines, if this handler is capable of handling properties that are contained in the specified column specification.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the unique id of this handler.
        Returns:
        Unique ID. Must not be null.

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        Returns the display name of this handler.
        Returns:
        Display name. Must not be null.

      • getAcceptableProperties

        java.lang.String[] getAcceptableProperties()
        Returns the property keys that this handler is capable of processing.
        Returns:
        Acceptable properties. Never null, at least one element.

      • getDataValueClass

        java.lang.Class<? extends DataValue> getDataValueClass()
        Returns the data value class that is used to visualize the property or properties.
        Returns:
        Data value class. Can be null, if data value class could not be found (if the implementing plug-in is not installed.

      • getDefaultRepresentationMode

        RepresentationMode getDefaultRepresentationMode()
        Returns the default representation mode to be used for this handler.
        Returns:
        Default representation mode. Never null.

      • getRendererFactories

        DataValueRendererFactory[] getRendererFactories()
        Returns alle renderer factories that are able to render the data value representation of the property.
        Returns:
        Renderer factory. Can be empty, but never null.

      • getPreferredRenderer

        DataValueRenderer getPreferredRenderer(HeaderProperty headerProperty)
        Returns the render set in the preferences to be used for visualizing the data value of the property.
        Parameters:
        headerProperty - The header property to get a renderer for. It is passed in to call the method HeaderProperty.getColumnSpecForRendering() in order to get special information for rendering, if possible.
        Returns:
        Renderer to be used, if user did not select a special one for a column.

      • getPreferredDimension

        java.awt.Dimension getPreferredDimension(HeaderProperty headerProperty)
        Returns the preferred dimension that shall be used when visualizing the data value of the property.
        Parameters:
        headerProperty - The header property to determine the preferred dimension for.
        Returns:
        The preferred dimension. Can be null, if there is nothing to be rendered.

      • isCompatible

        boolean isCompatible(DataColumnSpec colSpec)
        Determines, if this handler is capable of handling properties that are contained in the specified column specification.
        Parameters:
        colSpec - Column specification with properties. Can be null to return false.
        Returns:
        True, if theser are properties present that could be handled by this handler. False otherwise.

      • createHeaderProperty

        HeaderProperty createHeaderProperty(DataColumnSpec colSpec)
        Creates based on a property or properties found in the specified column specification a header property object, which is at the same time a data value object that will be passed to the renderer later for rendering it into a header or tooltip.
        Parameters:
        colSpec - Column specification with properties. Can be null to return null.
        Returns:
        Data value or null, if it could not be created.
